metadata.title: Thursday, 2nd October, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    how many Rural Health Centres in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency have solar power;
(b)    of these Centres, how many solar installations are fully functioning;
(c)    when those which are non-functional, if any, will be repaired; and
(d)    when those centres without solar power will be provided with the same.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the following roads in Chasefu Parliamentary Constituency will be graded:
(i)    Emusa-Munyukwa-Chifunda; and (ii)    Egi Chikeni-Mtwalo-Kamuone;
(b)    when the Chasefu-Sangu Mine road will undergo periodic maintenance; and
(c)    what has caused the delay in commencing the maintenance works.
(a)    what the name of the contractor engaged to rehabilitate the Kabwe Venus Theatre is;
(b)    what measures the Ministry has taken to ensure that the materials bought for the rehabilitation of the Theatre do not go to waste; and
(c)    who supervises the rehabilitation exercise.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    of the amount of money budgeted for rehabilitation of feeder roads in Masaiti Parliamentary Constituency in the 2014 budget, how much had been released as of June, 2014; and
(b)    which feeder roads had been worked on, as of July, 2014.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when a university will be constructed in North-Western Province.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of the College of Science and Mathematics in Nchelenge will commence; and
(b)    why the construction of the institution was omitted from the 2014 Operational Plan for Educational Infrastructure.
(a)    what the proportion of rural households living within a 5km radius of the nearest health facility in relation to the population in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency is; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to reduce the distance to health facilities in rural areas in the Constituency.
(a)    what the staff establishment for the following courts in Kaputa District is:
(i)    Local Courts; and (ii)    Magistrates Court;
(b)    how many positions were vacant as of May, 2014; and
(c)    when the vacancies will be filled.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    what action has been taken against the contractor who abandoned the works on the Kelongwa-Nyoka-Lufwanyama Road;
(b)    what the total cost of the project was; and
(c)    how much money was paid to the contractor.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of a vocational training centre in Sesheke Parliamentary Constituency will commence; and
(b)    what progress has been made regarding the project to-date.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to turn Prospect Police Post into a fully fledged Police Station and, if there are no such plans, why;
(b)    when Prospect Police Post will be provided with a vehicle for operations; and
(c)    when a police ambulance will be provided to Prospect Police Post for emergency rescue operations of road traffic accident victims on the Great North Road.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    whether any exploration for oil was ever conducted in the Barotse Plains or in any other part of Western Province between 1993 and 2013;
(b)    if so, what the results of the explorations were; and
(c)    if not, when the Government intends to undertake the exploration exercise.
(a)    why construction works at the Katete Main Police Station have stalled;
(b)    who the contractor of the project is; and
(c)    what the time-frame for completion of the project is.
(a)    how many camp extension officers were employed by the Government as of 31st December, 2013;
(b)    what the total establishment for camp extension officers country-wide is; and
(c)    what measures the Government has taken to reduce the extension officer-farmer ratio.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication what measures the Government has taken to encourage transportation of cargo by rail in order to preserve the life span of the roads.
questions.question_text: ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address – Motion (23rd September)  - Resumption of Debate.
